sentences.english: His answer was a torrent of abuses.
sentences.chinese: 他的回答是連珠炮式的“漫罵”。

sentences.english: They hurled abuse and insults at the speaker.
sentences.chinese: 他們漫罵和侮辱演講人。

sentences.english: Both direct volleys of abuse at Mr Bush.
sentences.chinese: 兩人都將漫罵的矛頭指向布什先生。

sentences.english: The comment only slammed but had no analysis at all.
sentences.chinese: 該篇評論只是在漫罵，根本沒有分析評論。

definition: all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: to whisper to one another's ear
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
men and women should not touch hands when they give or receive things (citation, from Mencius)
pinyin: nan2 nu:3 shou4 shou4 bu4 qin1

definition: lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
shouting abuse in the street like a fishwife
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
lit. a thief crying "Stop the thief!" (idiom)/fig. to accuse sb of a theft and try to sneak away oneself/to cover up one's misdeeds by shifting the blame onto others
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
lit. Lord Ye's passion for dragons (idiom)/fig. to pretend to be fond of sth while actually fearing it/ostensible fondness of sth one really fears
